issues.description: The problem statement specifies a static method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int (UML and text), but both the template's example code (Main) and the solution implement and call a method named computeMealCost(Meal). This name/signature mismatch between the specification and the provided code will confuse students about which method name to implement and may cause tests or example code to fail to find the expected method.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method name consistent across all artifacts. Either rename the method in template and solution from computeMealCost to calculateTotalPrice (and update any calls in Main and tests), or update the problem statement and UML to use computeMealCost everywhere. Ensure the chosen name, signature (Meal parameter) and static modifier match the specification and example code.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) requires a static method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal) to compute the net cost of a meal, but the solution implementation defines this functionality as computeMealCost(Meal) and the template's commented Main also references computeMealCost. Additionally, the solution's Main calls calculateTotalPrice while the SealSaloon implementation provides computeMealCost. This inconsistent naming for the same conceptual operation (compute the total price of a Meal) across problem, template comments, and solution code creates confusion for students about which method to implement or call.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across all artifacts. Prefer matching the problem UML and rename the implementation to calculateTotalPrice (e.g., public static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal) in SealSaloon) and update all calls (Main and any comments) accordingly. Alternatively, if you prefer computeMealCost, update the problem statement and UML to use computeMealCost consistently — but do not mix both names.
